alert.note: Alert for Baker County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 1:56PM PST until January 03 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 10 PM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 4 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except 2 to 7 inches over the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except 2 to 9 inches over the mountains. There will be a break of around 12 hours with little to no snow in between the two advisories. * WHERE...Baker County zone. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM to 10 PM PST Monday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Tuesday to 4 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow may result in continuously covered roads, and snow will blow back on to the roads very soon after they are plowed.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
